member.summary: Allow all changes.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.Converters.BinaryDoc.Permissions.ProtectionType.iProtReadWrite
member.summary: Allow the editing of the regions that are marked as editable in forms.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.Converters.BinaryDoc.Permissions.ProtectionType.iProtRevision
member.summary: Allow the creation, deletion, and editing of annatations. For all other changes: Allow them, but track them with revision marks.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.Converters.BinaryDoc.Permissions.ProtectionType.iProtComment
member.summary: Allow the creation, deletion, and editing of annotations, but allow no other changes.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.Converters.BinaryDoc.Permissions.ProtectionType.iProtRead
member.summary: Allow no changes.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.Converters.BinaryDoc.Permissions.Prti.iProt

member.name: M:Spire.Doc.Documents.Converters.Packaging.OmlPackageW.PartNameToZipName(System.String)
member.summary:
According to the OPC specification there is a quite complex algorithm to map from a ZIP entry name to a part name. It is complex because ZIP entry names are ASCII characters, whereas part names can contain Unicode characters, some characters need escaping and so on. These methods map from part name to zip name and back.
So far there is a very simplistic implementation.
RK We have to test with image file names containing Unicode characters and finish these methods.

members.member: Sets the GIF frame disposal code for the last added frame and any subsequent frames. Default is 0 if no transparent color has been set, otherwise 2. @param code int disposal code.

Sets the transparent color for the last added frame and any subsequent frames. Since all colors are subject to modification in the quantization process, the color in the final palette for each frame closest to the given color becomes the transparent color for that frame. May be set to null to indicate no transparent color.
@param c Color to be treated as transparent on display.

Adds next GIF frame. The frame is not written immediately, but is actually deferred until the next frame is received so that timing data can be inserted. Invoking finish() flushes all frames. If setSize was not invoked, the size of the first image is used for all subsequent frames.
@param im BufferedImage containing frame to write. @return true if successful.
Flushes any pending data and closes output file. If writing to an OutputStream, the stream is not closed.

Sets quality of color quantization (conversion of images to the maximum 256 colors allowed by the GIF specification). Lower values (minimum = 1) produce better colors, but slow processing significantly. 10 is the default, and produces good color mapping at reasonable speeds. Values greater than 20 do not yield significant improvements in speed.
@param quality int greater than 0. @return
Analyzes image colors and creates color map.

member.name: T:Spire.Doc.Documents.TextDirection
member.summary: Defines the direction of text.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.TextDirection.TopToBottom
member.summary: Specifies that text in the parent object shall flow from left to right horizontally, then top to bottom vertically on the page. This means that horizontal lines are filled before the text expands vertically.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.TextDirection.RightToLeft
member.summary: Specifies that text in the parent object shall flow from right to left horizontally, then top to bottom vertically on the page. This means that horizontal lines are filled before the text expands vertically.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.TextDirection.LeftToRightRotated
member.summary: Specifies that text in the parent object shall flow from top to bottom vertically, then left to right horizontally on the page. This means that horizontal lines are filled before the text expands vertically. This flow is also rotated such that all text is rotated 90 degrees when displayed on a page.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.TextDirection.LeftToRight
member.summary: Specifies that text in the parent object shall flow from bottom to top vertically, then from left to right horizontally on the page.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.TextDirection.TopToBottomRotated
member.summary: Specifies that text in the parent object shall flow from left to right horizontally, then top to bottom vertically on the page. This means that horizontal lines are filled before the text expands vertically. This flow is also rotated such that any East Asian text shall be rotated 270 degrees when displayed on a page.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.TextDirection.RightToLeftRotated
member.summary: Specifies that text in the parent object shall flow from top to bottom vertically, then right to left horizontally on the page. This means that horizontal lines are filled before the text expands vertically. This flow is also rotated such that all text is rotated 90 degrees when displayed on a page.

member.summary: This simple type specifies the set of possible aliases (or editing groups) which can be used as aliases to determine if the current user shall be allowed to edit a single range defined by a range permission with in a document. member.name: T:Spire.Doc.Layout.Native.GdiApi
member.summary: WinAPi functions.

member.name: M:Spire.Doc.Layout.Native.GdiApi.#ctor
member.summary: To prevent construction of a class, we make a private constructor.

member.name: M:Spire.Doc.Layout.Native.GdiApi.AddFontResource(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the font resource from the specified file to the system font table. The font can subsequently be used for text output by any application.
member.param: String that contains a valid font file name.
member.returns: If the function fails, the return value is zero.

member.name: M:Spire.Doc.Layout.Native.GdiApi.RemoveFontResource(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the fonts in the specified file from the system font table.
member.param: String that names a font resource file.
member.returns: If the function fails, the return value is zero.

member.name: M:Spire.Doc.Layout.Native.GdiApi.SelectObject(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Selects an object into the specified device context (DC). The new object replaces the previous object of the same type.
member.param: Handle to the object to be selected.
member.returns: If the selected object is not a region and the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the object being replaced.

member.name: M:Spire.Doc.Layout.Native.GdiApi.DeleteObject(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Deletes a logical pen, brush, font, bitmap, region, or palette, freeing all system resources associated with the object. After the object is deleted, the specified handle is no longer valid.
member.param: Handle to a logical pen, brush, font, bitmap, region, or palette.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.

member.name: M:Spire.Doc.Layout.Native.GdiApi.GetFontData(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Byte[],System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves font metric data for a TrueType font.
member.param: Specifies the name of a font metric table from which the font data is to be retrieved
Specifies the offset from the beginning of the font metric table to the location where the function should begin retrieving information.
Pointer to a buffer that receives the font information.
Specifies the length in bytes of the information to be retrieved
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the number of bytes returned.

member.name: M:Spire.Doc.Layout.Native.GdiApi.GetCharWidth(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Retrieves the widths, in logical coordinates, of consecutive characters in a specified range from the current font.
member.param: Specifies the first character in the group of consecutive characters.
Specifies the last character in the group of consecutive characters, which must not precede the specified first character.
Pointer to a buffer that receives the character widths, in logical coordinates.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.

member.name: M:Spire.Doc.Layout.Native.GdiApi.GetTextExtentPoint(System.IntPtr,System.String,System.Int32,System.Drawing.Size@)
member.summary: Computes the width and height of the specified string of text.
member.param: Pointer to a buffer that specifies the text string.
Specifies the length of the lpString buffer.
Pointer to a size structure that receives the dimensions of the string in logical units.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.

member.name: M:Spire.Doc.Layout.Native.GdiApi.GetCharABCWidths(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,Spire.Doc.Layout.Native.ABC@)
member.summary: Computes the width and height of the specified string of text.
member.param: Specifies the first character in the group of consecutive characters from the current font.
Specifies the last character in the group of consecutive characters from the current font.
Pointer to an array of ABC structures that receives the character widths, in logical units.
member.returns: The function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.

member.name: M:Spire.Doc.Layout.Native.GdiApi.SetTextColor(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: The SetTextColor function sets the text color for the specified device context to the specified color.
member.param: Specifies the color of the text.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a color reference for the previous text color as a COLORREF value.

member.name: M:Spire.Doc.Layout.Native.GdiApi.SetTextAlign(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: The SetTextAlign function sets the text-alignment flags for the specified device context.
member.param: Specifies the text alignment by using a mask of values.

member.name: T:Spire.Doc.WidthType
member.summary: The TableWidthType enum specifies how the preferred width for a table, table indent, table cell, cell margin, or cell spacing is defined.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.WidthType.None
member.summary: No Preffered Width

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.WidthType.Auto
member.summary: No preferred width is specified. The width is derived from other table measurements where a preferred size is specified, as well as from the size of the table contents, and the constraining size of the container of the table.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.WidthType.Percentage
member.summary: When specifying the preferred width of a portion of a table, such as a cell, spacing or indent, the percentage is relative to the width of the entire table. When specifying the preferred width of an entire table, the percentage is relative to the width of the page, less any margin or gutter space. Alternatively, if the table is nested inside another table, the percentage is relative to the width of the cell in the containing table, less cell margins.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.WidthType.Twip
member.summary: The preferred width of the table, indent, cell, cell margin, or cell spacing is an absolute width measured in twips.

member.summary: Defines shape attributes that occur in the binary Escher format, but not in the model. For more info see http://chicago.sourceforge.net/devel/docs/escher/

member.summary: No ctor.

member.summary: Untested. Bounds of the unrotated shape expressed as top left and bottom right in drawing units. Default 0.

member.summary: Untested. Bounds of the unrotated shape expressed as top left and bottom right in drawing units. Default 0.

member.summary: Untested. Bounds of the unrotated shape expressed as top left and bottom right in drawing units. Default 1.

member.summary: Untested. Bool. Default false. RK I've never seen these stored as properties. Instead, shape flip flag is used and we store it as property. Maybe I should use these instead.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.EsShapeAttr.TransformFlipHorizontal
member.summary: See comments above.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.EsShapeAttr.TransformFlags
member.summary: NOT IN THE MODEL. It occurs in the DOC file, but in the model it is converted into individual attributes described above.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.EsShapeAttr.LockAgainstUngrouping
member.summary: Untested. Do not ungroup this shape. Default false. Ver: XP

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.EsShapeAttr.LockFlags
member.summary: It occurs in the DOC file, but in the model it is converted into individual attributes described above. This is a bit flag for the boolean properties in the protection group.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.EsShapeAttr.TextboxFlags
member.summary: NOT IN THE MODEL. It occurs in the DOC file, but in the model it is converted into individual attributes described above. This is a bit flag for the boolean properties in the text group.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.EsShapeAttr.GeoTextFlags
member.summary: The attribute that contains the above boolean flags.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.EsShapeAttr.ImageBlipId
member.summary:
NOT IN THE MODEL. This occurs in the DOC file, but in the model, it is replaced by the ImageBytes attribute. Blip to display. 1-based index into the blip store. It seems to be 1 for all inline pictures where the blip is stored after the shape record.
The SPEC says: 1. The value 0 must be ignored. I don't think we do this yet. 2. Escher property fComplex = 1 means the image bytes are stored in the property itself, not in the blip store. We don't support this yet.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.EsShapeAttr.ImageName
member.summary:
NOT IN THE MODEL. Occurs in the DOC file, but in the model it is stored either in ImageSrc or ImageTitle attribute.
A Unicode null-terminated string that specifies the comment, the file name, or the URL of the BLIP as specified by the pibFlags property.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.EsShapeAttr.ImageNameFlags
member.summary: NOT IN THE MODEL. Occurs in the DOC file, but not stored in the model. Blip flags.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.EsShapeAttr.ImagePrint
member.summary: Blip to display when printing. Never seen this, not supported at the moment.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.EsShapeAttr.ImagePrintName
member.summary: Blip file name. Never seen this, not supported at the moment.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.EsShapeAttr.ImagePrintNameFlags
member.summary: Blip flags. Never seen this, not supported at the moment.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.EsShapeAttr.ImageMovieData
member.summary: Untested. MOVIE type. Movie data. Ver: 98

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.EsShapeAttr.ImageMovieRewind
member.summary: bool. Should we rewind the movie when done playing. Ver: 98

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.EsShapeAttr.ImageMovieLoop
member.summary: bool. Is movie looping. Ver: 98

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.EsShapeAttr.ImageFlags
member.summary: NOT IN THE MODEL. This occurs in the DOC file, but in the model it is replaced with the individual attributes above. This is a bit flag for the boolean properties in the picture group.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.EsShapeAttr.GeometryLeft
member.summary:
A signed integer specifying the left coordinate of the geometry space coordinate system for this shape. Default 0.
The geoLeft, geoTop, geoRight, and geoBottom properties combine to define a rectangle that specifies an arbitrary coordinate system, called geometry space, that geometry coordinates are specified in. When a shape is rendered, any points specified in geometry space are translated into the coordinate system of the shape by matching the geometry space rectangle with the bounding rectangle of the shape and scaling appropriately.
These attributes occur only for custom shapes. Other shapes that have coordorigin and coordsize are group shapes, but they store this attributes in the record.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.EsShapeAttr.GeometryTop
member.summary: A signed integer specifying the top coordinate of the geometry space coordinate system for this shape. Default 0.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.EsShapeAttr.GeometryRight
member.summary: A signed integer specifying the bottom coordinate of the geometry space coordinate system for this shape. Default 21600.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.EsShapeAttr.GeometryShapePath
member.summary:
This property specifies the way the lines in this shape are to be drawn.
An enumeration value that specifies how vertices in this shape, as specified in the property, are connected. If the value is , then the property MUST exist and contain the more detailed instructions on how to connect vertices in this shape. If property is not NULL and not empty, then this property MUST be ignored and the connections between vertices are specified by the property. The default value for this property is .

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.ShapeAttr.TextboxTxid
member.summary:
int. id for the textbox.
Although this attribute will be present in the model during write to DOC, it does not have any meaning for the model.
This is an index into plcfTxbxs, but need to deduct one and shift right by 16 bits. int txid = (int)((txbxIdx + 1) shl 16);
The lower 16 bits indicate the index of the linked checkbox.
This attribute is only used during reading and writing into binary DOC. There is a two-way link between shape and txbx in a DOC file and during read.
Also see OleTxid. OleTxid is written instead of TextboxTxid for OLE objects.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.ShapeAttr.GeometryXLimo
member.summary:
int. A signed integer x coordinate in geometry space that specifies a value above which limousine scaling is used. The spec says default is 0x8000000, but we default to 0 at the moment!
Limo stretches are points on a shape's edge that define where and how a shape may be stretched by a user in a graphical editor.
2.3.6.22 xLimo in the DOC SPEC

member.summary: Untested. String. This property is present if the shape represents an equation generated by Office 2007 or later. The property is a string of XML representing a Word 2003 XML document. The original equation is stored within the oMathPara tag within the document. Refer to the Office Open XML documentation for details on this XML representation of equations. If the document containing the shape is opened in Office 2007 or later, the shape is replaced with the equation in this document. Ver: 2007

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.ShapeAttr.ShapeName
member.summary:
Shape Name (present only if explicitly set).
RK One scenario where this is used is to create relationships between diagram nodes. Instead of basing relationships on shape ids, the relationships are created based on shape names (in DOC, RTF and model based on hashes of shape names). Shape id might change (at least can change in Spire.Doc when document is saved), shape name, on the other hand remains the same and makes the life easier (no need to update diagram relations). Shape name is usually generated by MS Word based on the shape id.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.ShapeAttr.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary:
When this attribute is specified, the shape is positioned using alignment relative to some object. The relative anchor is specified using the relative horizontal position value, all values are valid.
When the alignment value is Inside our Outside (in MS Word this is in the Book Layout dropdown), then MS Word allows the relative anchor to be only Margin or Page.
Occurs in EsShapeOptionsEx record. Note the values in the SPEC are wrong (off by 1).

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.ShapeAttr.BorderTopColor
member.summary:
These are 32bit color for the inline picture borders. Occur in EsShapeOptionsEx record. We read this attribute into the model initially, so it could occur in the model.
If the shape is an inline picture, then when the PICF structure is loaded, the 32bit colors specified by these attributes are applied to the borders. The border attributes BorderXXX are added to the model and these attributes are removed.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.ShapeAttr.MetroBlob
member.summary: Untested. Seen complex value in defect 3397. The shapes 2007 representation in Office Open XML format. The actual data is a package in Office XML format, which can simply be opened as a zip file. This zip file contains an XML file with the root element sp. Refer to the publically available Office Open XML documentation for more information about this data. In case we lose any property when converting a 2007 Office Art shape to 2003 shape, we use this blob to retrieve the original Office Art property data when opening the file in 2007. See Appendix F for more information. Ver: 2007

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Core.DataStreamParser.Escher.ShapeAttr.Dhgt
member.summary: Untested. The shapes unique z-order, ranging from 1 to 503316479. The higher the number, the closer to in-front the shape is. Ver: 2007.

member.summary: No Preffered Width

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.FtsWidth.Auto
member.summary: No preferred width is specified. The width is derived from other table measurements where a preferred size is specified, as well as from the size of the table contents, and the constraining size of the container of the table.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.FtsWidth.Percentage
member.summary: Preferred table width specified in percentage. The preferred width is measured in units of 1/50th of a percent.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.FtsWidth.Point
member.summary: The preferred width of the table,indent,cell,cell margin, or cell spacing is an absolute width measured in twips.

member.summary: The preferred cell spacing is an absoute width measured in twips.
